description: TO RECOMMIT H. R. 17 (3 STAT. 544, 3/3/1820), A BILL PROVI- DING FOR THE ADMISSION OF THS STATE OF MAINE TO THE UNION, TO THE COMMITEE ON THE JUDICIARY WITH INSTRUCTIONS.  (P.101)

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF A RESOLUTION, AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION SO AS TO PROVIDE A UNIFORM METHOD OF ELECTING ELECTORS FOR PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT AND REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS.  (P.233)

TO AMEND THE CONSTITUTIONAL RESOLUTION BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE THAT PERSONS QUALIFIED TO VOTE FOR REPRESENTATIVES IN EACH DISTRICT SHALL CHOOSE ONE ELECTOR, AND THAT THE TWO ADDITIONAL TO WHICH EACH STATE IS ENTITLED SHALL BE APPOINT- ED AS THE LEGISLAURE DIRECTS; AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF A PROVISION THAT EACH STATE SHALL BE DIVIDED INTO DISTRICTS EQUAL TO THE NUMBER OF ELECTORS TO WHICH EACH STATE IS EN- TITLED AND PEOPLE QUALIFIED TO VOTE IN EACH DISTRICT SHALL CHOOSE ONE ELECTOR
TO ADOPT THE CONSTITUTIONAL RESOLUTION.  (P.278)
TO AMEND H. R. 17 (3 STAT. 545, 3/6/1820), BY PROHIBITING SLAVERY OR INVOLUNTARY SERVITUDE IN THE ADMISSION OF THE STATE OF MISSOURI TO THE UNION.  (P.359)

TO AMEND S. 18 (3 STAT. 566, 4/24/1820), A BILL MAKING PRO- VISION FOR THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS, BY ADDING A PROVISION GIVING PURCHASERS OF PUBLIC LANDS PERMISSION TO SURRENDER SAME BEFORE DAY OF FINAL PAYMENT, BY DELIVERING THEIR CERTI- FICATES TO THE RGISTER, AUTHORIZING SALE OF LAND AND CAN- CELLING CERTIFICATES, BUT IF LAND IS SOLD FOR MORE THAN $1.00 PER ACRE THE EXCESS SHALL BE PAID TO FORMER CERTIFI- CATE HOLDER, PROVIDING THAT SUCH EXCESS DOES NOT EXCEED ORIGINAL PAYMENT ON SUCH CERTIFICATE
TO AMEND S. 18, BY PROVIDING THAT PREFERENCE IN THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS BE GIVEN TO PERSONS LIVING THEREON, AND DEFIN- ING PROCEDURE FOR FILING CLAIM.
TO AMEND S. 18, BY ELIMINATING THAT PART WHICH PROVIDES THAT SALES SHALL BE PAID IN CASH, AND LEAVING THAT PART WHICH DIRECTS THE LANDS TO BE OFFERED FOR SALE IN HALF QUARTERS.
TO PASS S. 18.  (P.489)
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 9, A BILL WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY.

TO AMEND H. R. 9, BY DEFINING A PERSON WHO MAY BE CONSIDERED A VOLUNTARY BANKRUPT, ACKNOWLEDGING HIMSELF AS SUCH, TO RE- CEIVE A CERTIFICATE OF DISCHARGE FROM ANY IMPRISONMENT BY VIRTURE OF LEGAL PROCESS, AS THE RESULT OF CIVIL ACTION, AND TO APPOINT A CMMISSIONER TO LIQUIDATE ANY ASSETS OF PERSON INVOLVED

TO AMEND H. R. 9, BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE WHICH EXTENDS AID TO FARMERS, AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF, THAT DISCHARGE FROM BANKRUPTCY SHALL NOT RELEASE ANY DEBT DUE, OR TO BECOME DUE, TO ANY PERSON OR PERSONS NOT SUBJECT TO THE COMMISSION OF BANKRUPTCY BUT ANY SUCH DEBT UNSATISFIED, MAY BE SUED FOR AS IF NO CERTIFICATE OF DISCHARGE HAD BEEN GRANTED
TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 9, WHICH AMENDMENT EXTENDS THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT TO ALL OTHER PERSONS, BUT AT THEIR OWN INSISTENCE, AND BY THEIR VOLUNTARY CONSENT.  (P.543, 544)
